name: 3dWinsor
author: AFNI Developers
description: Apply a 3D 'Winsorizing' filter to a short-valued dataset.

inputs.description: Include all points within 'distance' rr in the operation, where distance is defined as sqrt(i*i+j*j+k*k), and (i,j,k) are voxel index offsets.
inputs.name: Radius

inputs.description: Set bottom clip index to bb.
inputs.name: Bottom clip index

inputs.description: Set top clip index to tt.
inputs.name: Top clip index

inputs.description: Repeat filter nn times. If nn < 0, means to repeat filter until less than abs(n) voxels change.
inputs.name: Repeat filter

inputs.description: Don't filter voxels that are zero.
inputs.name: Keep zero voxels

inputs.description: Set voxels at or below 'xx' to zero.
inputs.name: Clip value

inputs.description: Use 'pp' as the prefix for the output dataset.
inputs.name: Output prefix

inputs.description: Use 'mmm' as a mask dataset - voxels NOT in the mask won't be filtered.
inputs.name: Mask dataset

inputs.description: Input dataset to apply the filter on.
inputs.name: Input dataset

output-files.description: Output dataset with Winsorizing filter applied.
output-files.name: Output dataset HEAD

output-files.description: Output dataset with Winsorizing filter applied.
output-files.name: Output dataset BRIK
